title: 18-100af12.jpg
description: The Intermediate Value Theorem: If f is a function which is continuous on the closed interval [a, b], and u is a real number between f(a) and f(b), then there exists c in [a, b] such that f(c) = u. Image by MIT OpenCourseWare.

image_metadata.caption: The Intermediate Value Theorem: If f is a function which is continuous on the closed interval \[a, b\], and u is a real number between f(a) and f(b), then there exists c in \[a, b\] such that f(c) = u. (Image by MIT OpenCourseWare.)
image_metadata.image-alt: Graph of the Intermediate Value Theorem.
